prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section.** The dimensions of the prism are approximately 1:2:3. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system.** Set the euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) degrees and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.05, 0.0). This will position and orient the 2D sketch plane for part 1. **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch.** Draw a rectangle on the sketch plane. The rectangle should have four lines: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.1) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.1), End Point (0.0, 0.1) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.1), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The rectangle forms a single, closed loop. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch.** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. This will adjust the size of the rectangle to match the desired dimensions of the prism. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Use the transformed 2D sketch to create a 3D sketch. The euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system will be used to determine the orientation and position of the 3D sketch. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model.** Extrude the rectangle along the normal direction by 0.05 units. Do not extrude in the opposite direction. The resulting 3D model will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The length of the prism will be 0.75 units, the width will be 0.05 units, and the height will be 0.75 units. **Step 6: Complete the part.** This completes the instructions for part 1. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with the specified dimensions. The shape can be further modified or combined with other parts using boolean operations to create more complex CAD models.</description>

</json>
